  • Tata Consultancy Services reported a 200 DMA of Rs 4123.84 and a last traded price (LTP) of Rs 4265.65.

title: Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you're unwell during sick leaves | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you’re unwell during sick leaves

Date: October 2023 Source: Agence France-Presse

Companies in Germany are increasingly hiring detectives to investigate employees taking sick leave, amidst a backdrop of high absenteeism and a struggling economy. This troubling trend is highlighted by a rise in sick leave checks driven by concerns over productivity.

  • Significant scrutiny on sick leave practices in Germany.
  • Companies report a surge in requests for detective services to verify employee health.
  • A concerning trend of high sick leave rates impacting the economy, with 6.8% of working hours missed due to illness in 2023.
  • Economic contraction of 0.3 percent attributed to absenteeism.
“If someone has 30, 40 or sometimes up to 100 sick days in a year, then at some point they become economically unattractive for the employer.” - Marcus Lentz

The growing number of sick days has prompted fierce debates about work culture and employee wellness practices, especially against the backdrop of calls for longer work hours in other countries.
newTitle: Companies in Germany Hire Detectives to Verify Sick Leaves Amid Growing Scrutiny

summary:
Weakness in Nifty could intensify: Technical Analysts

Publication Date & Source: October 2023, ET Markets

The Nifty index is showing signs of sustained weakness with indicators suggesting potential downside momentum. Analysts warn of increasing risk if the index breaks below key support levels.

  • Daily and weekly charts show sustained weakness in Nifty.
  • A break below 23,263 may propel Nifty towards 22,800.
  • A close above 24,750 could spark a short-covering rally.
  • Analysts identified strong bullish patterns in stocks such as Maruti, Eicher Motors, Bajaj Finserv, and HCL Tech.
  • Investors are advised to prioritize strict risk management while trading.
“The underlying trend is weak. A decisive slide below the support of 23,260 could open the next lower support for Nifty at around 22,700 in the near term.” - Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst, HDFC Securities

In conclusion, traders should be cautious and prepare for possible further declines in the Nifty index while identifying opportunities in positively trending sectors.
newTitle: Weakness in Nifty could intensify: Technical Analysts

The Nifty 50 is struggling around the 23,350 mark as it sees significant downward movement, with technical analysis suggesting potential support and resistance levels. Analysts examine potential targets and recovery points.

  • The Nifty 50 and Bank Nifty have experienced three consecutive days of decline.
  • If Nifty breaks 23,350, it may extend down to 23,263 or even 23,000.
  • A rebound above 23,600 could lead to movement towards 23,800-24,000.

title: Air India ‘bullish’ on long-haul travel - The Hindu
summary:
Air India ‘bullish’ on long-haul travel

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Air India Group is experiencing rapid growth in long-haul travel as it completes three years of privatization. The airline is expanding its international reach significantly.

  • The airline’s market share on international routes has increased from 16% to 21% since the Tata Group acquisition.
  • Air India has added nine new long-haul routes, raising the total to 37 served routes.
  • Daily flight frequencies on these routes have more than doubled from 30 to 69.
  • The airline aims to increase its share of international passengers from 21% to 50%.
  • Air India generated nearly 50% of its total revenue from lucrative long-haul routes.
  • The airline plans to enhance connectivity and attract transit passengers by reducing connection times.
“Indian airlines enjoy only 21% share of total international passengers, while there is room to grow up to 50%.”

With strategic expansions and fleet upgrades, Air India is positioning itself for major growth in the competitive long-haul travel market.
newTitle: Air India Optimistic About Long-Haul Travel Growth

title: Air India to offer first class seats in A350-1000 planes to compete with best airlines | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Air India to Offer First Class Seats in A350-1000 Plans

Publication Date: New Delhi

Air India is set to include first class seats in its A350-1000 aircraft as part of its strategy to enhance its presence in the competitive airline market.

  • Air India's Chief Commercial Officer emphasized the importance of first class as a niche market.
  • The airline's fleet currently consists of 202 planes, with various routes identified for first class service.
  • Air India anticipates inducting A350-1000s in the coming years, with an initial focus on major markets like London and New York.
  • Efforts to retrofit existing aircraft, including Boeing 787s and legacy Airbus 320 neos, are underway.
  • The retrofit of Boeing 777 aircraft commences next year to improve service reliability.
"To compete with the best airlines you need to have first class, it is an aspirational product..." - Nipun Aggarwal, Chief Commercial Officer

The introduction of first class seating aims to enhance Air India's competitiveness and attract premium passengers, leveraging opportunities in strategic markets.
newTitle: Air India to Introduce First Class Seats in A350-1000 to Compete Globally

title: Indian crypto exchange Mudrex explains withdrawal suspension - Cointelegraph
summary:
Mudrex Temporarily Halts Crypto Withdrawals Amid Community Backlash

Date: January 11, 2023 | Source: Cointelegraph

Indian cryptocurrency exchange Mudrex has halted crypto withdrawals until January 28, 2023, triggering backlash from users concerned about fund security. The suspension aims to upgrade the platform's compliance framework.

  • Mudrex paused withdrawals on January 11, 2023.
  • Co-founder Edul Patel emphasized the need for proper infrastructure to prevent misuse.
  • Community members expressed skepticism and urgency in warning others to withdraw funds.
  • Mudrex reported significant user growth and trading volume amidst increasing regulatory scrutiny in India.
  • CoinDCX has introduced crypto withdrawals, allowing limited users to opt in.
“You need to do that with something as critical as crypto. If the infrastructure is not correct, it is very easy for it to be misused...” – Edul Patel, Co-founder of Mudrex

The temporary suspension has raised concerns about trust and security among Mudrex users, reflecting the larger challenges faced by cryptocurrency exchanges in India.
newTitle: Mudrex Temporarily Halts Crypto Withdrawals Amid Community Backlash

title: JNPA will become first Indian port cross 10 mn TEU capacity mark: Wagh - Business Standard
summary:
JNPA Aims to Become India's First Port to Cross 10 Million TEU Capacity

Date: Jan 12 2025 | Source: Business Standard

Jawaharlal Nehru Port Authority (JNPA), India’s largest state-owned container port, is set to become the first port in the country to reach a capacity of 10 million TEU.

  • JNPA achieved a record capacity of 7.05 million TEU in 2024.
  • The port's growth is partly attributed to the under-construction Vadhvan Port, projected to rank among the top 10 container-handling ports worldwide.
  • Once completed, Vadhvan Port is expected to handle 23.2 million TEU.
“In 2024, JNPA handled 7.05 million TEU, the highest ever in its history.” – Unmesh Wagh

This significant growth positions JNPA on the path to becoming a major player in global maritime logistics.
newTitle: JNPA Aims to Become India's First Port to Cross 10 Million TEU Capacity

title: Windsor has created much-needed disruption in EV market: Parth Jindal - Business Standard
summary:
Windsor Disruption Boosts EV Sales, Says Parth Jindal

Publication Date: October 2024 | Source: Business Standard

Windsor, launched in September 2024, has successfully disrupted the electric vehicle (EV) market, according to Parth Jindal, Director of JSW MG Motor India.

The new model helped JSW MG Motor’s sales rise significantly while overall market growth was modest, showcasing its impact.

  • JSW MG Motor's sales grew 35% YoY to 20,580 units in Q4 2024.
  • Overall EV industry sales increased by only 5.4% YoY to 1.07 million units.
  • The MG Windsor aims to democratize electric mobility on Indian roads.
  • Electric car sales for JSW MG Motor doubled in 2024.
  • JSW’s market share in Indian electric car sales increased from 11.5% in 2023 to 21.66% in 2024.
  • Tata Motors’ market share declined from 72.68% to 62% over the same period.
“With several new launches planned, we are confident of surpassing previous benchmarks.” – Parth Jindal

This disruption in the EV market reflects a significant shift as consumers embrace more affordable and innovative electric vehicles.
newTitle: Windsor Disruption Boosts EV Sales, Says Parth Jindal

title: Stay with sell on rally strategy until Nifty convincingly reclaims 23,800–24,000 zone - Moneycontrol
Air India plans more premium seats, eyes higher connecting traffic to tap 'huge growth opportunities' - Moneycontrol
summary:
Air India plans more premium seats, eyes higher connecting traffic to tap 'huge growth opportunities'

Date: January 12, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Air India is strategically increasing its premium economy and business class seating to tap into significant growth opportunities. Since the Tata Group took over in 2022, the airline's revenue has surged almost tenfold.

  • Air India will add more premium economy and business class seats to its fleet.
  • Realignment of flight timings is set to enhance connecting traffic.
  • Daily flights stand at 1,168, with 313 international destinations.
  • Revenue growth for premium segments has increased 2.3X, compared to 1.3X for economy.
“We are very focused on the premium segment and there are huge opportunities,” said Nipun Aggarwal, Chief Commercial Officer.

In conclusion, Air India's expansion into the premium seating market reflects a robust strategy to leverage existing growth opportunities and enhance its service offerings further.
newTitle: Air India Expands Premium Offerings to Capture Growth Market
